TopicTitle: Thirty Days Till All Hallows Eve

Articles.Content: Only thing comes to mind after watching is Holy Mackerel
2015 is the first year in 666 years that Halloween is Friday the 13th.
A traditional Halloween:

2015 is the first year in 666 years that Halloween is Friday the 13th.

And Mars will look bigger than the moon that day...

http://www.snopes.com/holidays/halloween/halloween13.asp
I couldn't care less about All Hallows Eve. But I do like fall, it's my favorite of the seasons. It has an interesting aesthetic and the rains are always welcomed.

Seriously? They had to do a Snopes article on that one? The fact that our current calendar has only been in use for about 430 years wasn't a clue? Or that Halloween is always on the 31st of October, so couldn't ever fall on a Friday the 13th wasn't an even bigger one? People's gullibility never ceases to amaze me...

...Speaking of which, did you know that the word "gullibility" isn't in the dictionary?...

Seriously? They had to do a Snopes article on that one? The fact that our current calendar has only been in use for about 430 years wasn't a clue? Or that Halloween is always on the 31st of October, so couldn't ever fall on a Friday the 13th wasn't an even bigger one? People's gullibility never ceases to amaze me...

There's probably a psychological trick about why that works. The age of the calendar isn't exactly common knowledge. But the 13/31 discrepancy... it's probably like those really SIMPLE logic puzzles that 2nd graders would all catch but anyone over 20 gets wrong 90% of the time.

Edited October 2, 2015 by vger
In Australia we don't do Halloween. Just sayin'.

There's probably a psychological trick about why that works. The age of the calendar isn't exactly common knowledge. But the 13/31 discrepancy... it's probably like those really SIMPLE logic puzzles that 2nd graders would all catch but anyone over 20 gets wrong 90% of the time.

Yeah, when spelling I transposition letters all the time.

Let's just talk about sp00ky sc4ry sk31370ns instead of how the calendar works. It's sp00k t1m3!

I'm so sorry, I truly am.

Yeah, when spelling I transposition letters all the time.

I do the same thing (on the keyboard anyway), but I call it a "timing error".
